Name:
HMS Echo
Navarinon (Greek: Ναυαρίνον)
awards:
Atlantic 1939
Norway 1940
Bismarck Action 1941
Arctic 1941–43
Malta Convoys 1942
Sicily 1943
Salerno 1943
Aegean 1943
Fate:
Transferred to Greece, 5 April 1944
Returned to the Royal Navy, 8 March 1956, and sold for scrapping.
Badge: On a Field Party per pale Green and Blue, two horns counterchanged Gold and Silver.
Displacement:
1,405 long tons (1,428 t) (standard)
1,940 long tons (1,970 t) (deep load)
Range: 6,350 nmi (11,760 km; 7,310 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × single QF 4.7-inch (120 mm) Mk IX guns
2 × quadruple 0.5-inch (12.7 mm) machine guns
2 × quadruple 21-inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
20 × depth charges, 1 rack and 2 throwers
